body.p:
To His Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette
Govener of the Commonweth of Kentucky.

Your Petitiones Citizens of Allen County Kentucky Beg lieve to represent to your Excellency That Thomas J. Cockrill Robinson Brown & Thomas Fisher citizens of Allen County Kentucky went the surity or bail of one John C. Wray who was under arrest charged with Treeson, to answer the charge in the Circuit Court. They State that since that time Judgement had been rendered upon bail bond in the sum of Five Thousand Dollars, the full amount of said bond which amount is they believe fully as much as they are now worth both real & personal They refer to the facts set forth in the petition of said Cockrill &c for the circumstances connected with the forfeiture of said the fact of his said Wrays death &c which they believe to be true They state that to require the said Parties to pay the full amount of said bond would entirely break them up and lieve their little families in neerly a starving condition and that in Equity Justice & good consince they aught not be required to pay the same and that it is a case well worthy the Executive Clemency. They therefore prey that your Excellency remit that the portion of said bond by law belonging to the State of Kentucky as they believes Justice & Mercy from the
from the circumstances in this case demand it for which they will ever pray &c.
